MDB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devin M Loomis

records.addlTxt: Jury trial on December 5, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Final pre-trial on November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

2:46 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin M Loomis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Devin M Loomis.
Covers 21CM169, 21CM231 and 22CM41
No agreement.

21CM169 - JT 12/5/22 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 11/29/22. Final pre-trial scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:00 am.

21CM231 - JT before Judge Bitney 11/14/22 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 10/31/22 

22CM41 - Back up JT 12/5/22 - Proposed Jury Instructions, Witness Lists, Verdict Forms, any Motions and Notice of Intent to Use Video are to be filed no later than 11/29/22.  Final pretrial scheduled for 11/29/22 at 10:00 a.m.

No address or phone number change.  Bonds continued.

2:06 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin M Loomis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Devin M Loomis. This covers cases 21CM169, 22CM41, & 21CM231.  Attorney Rockow relates DE was not able to make payment at last hearing or complete required tasks.  Court relates case will be removed from diversion and set all cases for sentencing.  State moves to terminate diversion court.  Court accepts voluntary withdrawal.  All cases set for 8/10/2022 at 1:30 PM.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin M Loomis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Devin M Loomis. 
Justice Programs Coordinator Shanda Harrington appears in court.

THIS COURT RECORD COVERS CASES 22CM41, 21CM169 and 21CM231

2:13  Court relates and gives appearances.  New agreement was filed with restitution requirement due to District Atty's office.  04/14/2022 was when Community Service work was supposed to be complete.  
2:16  Devin indicates he has only completed 12 hrs of community service work.  
2:17  Court questions Devin regarding employment; Court orders Devin to go to Job Fair directly after court today.
First objective: attend job fair directly after court today;
Pay $250 or more restitution by 07/07/2022.
2:20  Ms. Harrington relates.  
Devin to complete 25 hrs or more of Community Service work by 7/07/2022.
Restorative Justice referral is complete.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

2:00 PM Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin M Loomis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Devin M Loomis. 
Attorney Rockow relates this case is to be added to other files for Diversion Court.  State relates $50.00 diversion court fee does not need to be paid again.  Restitution discussed and is to be paid within 60 days of tomorrow.  Agreement filed in court and copies given to the parties.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

10:52 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Devin M Loomis in court.  Attorney Dustin Matthew Rockow in court for Devin M Loomis. 

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives further reading of the same.
NG pleas entered to all counts.
Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
